creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Mr and Mrs Makiji Hase
description: tall, slender pine tree; extends 3/4 of scroll; three line inscription at top; right scroll
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, and Seals 

upper quadrant: [ 圍家皆老松/蓊欝經千載/風雨捲雲涛/疑身在龍背//糾綬紫雲凝/頭頭出芝草/巍然見逸姿/宛是商山老//xx甲戌七月 ] (My house is completely surrounded by pines / Flourishing and extending in every direction. / In wind and rain like waves of rolling clouds, / I wonder - am I riding the back of a dragon? // Twisting ribbons of congealed purple clouds - / The fungus of the immortals! / I loftily watch these untrammeled forms, / Which are like the greybeards of Mount Shang.) (SA)
markings: URC: [ 二水 ] {Nisui}; upper center, square intaglio: [ 静逸 ] {Seiitu}
object_name: Hanging scroll, one of a pair
signed: URC; UC. Right: [ 信天翁并題] {Shinten’ō heidai}; left: [ 信天翁詩畫 ] {Shinten’ō shiga }
title: Pine [right of a pair of Pine and Rock]
